widget.name: Grid View
widget.description: Advanced gridview to browse and manipulate records and their attributes

property.caption: Data source microflow
property.description: Microflow that should return the dataset, given the retrieval parameters.

property.caption: Offset attribute
property.description: Retrieval parameter, that will be set by the widget to identify which objects should be retreived. Should be interpreted by the data source microflow.

property.caption: Limit attribute
property.description: Retrieval parameter, that will be set by the widget to identify how many objects should be retreived (equals the page size). Should be interpreted by the data source microflow.

property.caption: Search attribute
property.description: Retrieval parameter, that will be set by the widget to identify which objects should be retreived. Should be interpreted by the data source microflow. The search attribute is empty or empty string if no search filter is set by the user

property.caption: Count attribute
property.description: The count attribute *must* be *set and refreshed* by the datasource microflow, so that the widget knows how many items there in total. The count value should ignore limit and offset values, but apply the search value.

property.caption: Width
property.description: Width of this column. Please specify an unit, for example '60px' or '50%'. The field can be left empty.

property.caption: Sort attribute
property.description: If set, the grid can be sorted using this column.

property.caption: Default sort direction
property.description: The default sort direction if the grid is sorted using this column.

property.caption: Render in column
property.description: Zero based index column, to place this rendering in

property.caption: Caption
property.description: If mode is 'display a caption', provide the caption here. HTML is allowed here.

property.caption: Attribute
property.description: Attribute to display

property.caption: (Default) Image
property.description: Image to be rendered in front of the value. If mode is 'display a static image', this image is shown.

property.caption: Dataset (if referenceset or editable reference)
property.description: Provide the dataset if rendering an (editable) referenceset, or editable reference. See the widgets advanced > datasets section.

property.caption: On click action
property.description: The name of the action that should be invoked when this item is clicked. The name should refer to the name of an action as defined in step 5) Actions

property.caption: Class
property.description: The following classes are available by default: 'link', 'newline' (starts a newline before this value), 'right' (right align) 'separator', 'large' and 'small'

property.caption: Style
property.description: Define CSS properties here. Use newline or '|' to separate CSS properties (';') is not allowed!

property.caption: Column date time format
property.description: The formatting of the date if a datetime attribute is displayed.

property.caption: Search column
property.description: If true, search queries will include the value of this rendering in search queries.

property.caption: Conditional visiblity
property.description: Name of the condition (as defined in advanced > conditional visibility) which should be true if this property is to be displayed

property.caption: Prefix rendering
property.description: This (HTML) value will be rendered in front of each value.

property.caption: Postfix rendering
property.description: This (HTML) value will be rendered after each value.

property.caption: 'True' caption
property.description: If the value being displayed equals 'true', this caption will be displayed.

property.caption: 'False' caption
property.description: If the value being displayed equals 'false', this caption will be displayed.

property.caption: Editable column
property.description: Whether the value can be edited. Note that this is only supported for certain value types. (Currently: enumerations, booleans, references and referencesets)

property.caption: Always commit on change
property.description: Immediately commit when the value is changed? This property is ignored and defaults to false if a on change microflow is set.

property.caption: On change microflow
property.description: On change microflow that is triggered when the value is changed by the user.

property.caption: Action name
property.description: The name of this action, as can be refered to in Rendering > Interaction.

property.caption: Show as button in header
property.description: Create a toolbar button for this action?

property.caption: Button caption
property.description: Caption of the toolbar button.

property.caption: Button class
property.description: CSS class of the toolbar button.

property.caption: Button image
property.description: Image of the toolbar button.

property.caption: Hide if disabled
property.description: Whether to hide, or only disable the button when it can't be used.

property.caption: Assign association dataset
property.description: Create a dropdown menu for this button, based on the selected dataset (see advanced > datasets)

property.caption: Microflow (single selection)
property.description: Microflow that will be invoked on the current selection. If multiselection is enabled, the microflow will be invoked for each item in the selection, unless a multi selection microflow is set.

property.caption: Microflow (multi selection)
property.description: Optional microflow which can be set when multiselection is enabled. If this property is set, it will always be used, except when only zero or one objects are selected. If not set, the single selection microflow will be invoked for each individual item in the selection (Which might be expensive on large selectiosn).

property.caption: Allowed on multiselection
property.description: Can this action be invoked when multiple items are selected?

property.caption: Microflow (for context object)
property.description: If the action does not require a selection; use this microflow.

property.caption: Is default action
property.description: If true, this action will be used as default action and be invoked if an item is doubleclicked or the return key is pressed. Note that this option should be true for one action only.

property.caption: Fire on selection change
property.description: Invoke this action immediately when the current selection changes. For more information about retrieving the current selection, see the 'fine tuning > Selection reference' properties

property.caption: Confirmation message
property.description: If set, users have to confirm this message before continuing

property.caption: Search filters
property.description: This properties creates quick-filter dropdown buttons for the grid. A filter can be based on a boolean or enumeration value.

property.caption: Filter default
property.description: With which filter should the filter start?

property.caption: Page size
property.description: Number of items to display on a page.

property.caption: DEPRECATED. Use database optimization (does not work with virtual attributes)
property.description:
DEPRECATED. Should only used in Mendix 2.x or Mendix 3.x. Leave to true otherwise.
If true, the widget will optimize database retrievals for better performance. However, the widget will no longer support virtual attributes. If you need to use virtual attributes prior to Mendix 4, set this property to false! In general, we strongly recommend to not use virtual attributes in the gridview widget. Note that disabling this property might lead to strange behavior when updating refered attributes.

property.caption: Empty message
property.description: Message to be displayed when the grid does not hold any records

property.caption: Default column to sort on
property.description: Index of the column to sort on by default. Note that the first column is '0'. This value should always refer to a column that has a sort attribute.

property.caption: Refresh on context change
property.description: If true, the grid will reload when the context object is altered.

property.caption: Refresh on class change
property.description: Refresh when a class change is fired (create or delete of an object of the same type as viewed in the grid)

property.caption: Multi selection enabled
property.description: If true, multi selection actions can be used, an a checkbox is displayed in front of each row.

property.caption: Selection reference
property.description: This reference is updated as soon as the selection changes. This is useful to determine the current selection if action that fires on selection changes is used (see actions). For that action, set a microflow for the context action. The value of the reference selected here will be updated before that action fires.

property.caption: Multi selection reference set
property.description: See 'selection reference'. This reference set will be filled with the values of the multi selection.

property.caption: Real time search
property.description: Apply search while typing

property.caption: Search placeholder text
property.description: Default message to be displayed in the search box

property.caption: Search label dataset
property.description: If a dataset is provided, the values of this dataset will appear as dropdown list in the search box when searching

property.caption: Show item count in the paging section
property.description: If true, an info box with the amount of items and current selection is displayed in the paging section.

property.caption: Item count message
property.description: Information message about the amount of items and selection size. Use '{0}' to substitute the amount of items. Use '{1}' to substitute the selection size.

property.caption: Use floating layout
property.description: Use a floating layout with tiles, instead of a table layout with rows. All top level html items (table, thead, tr and td) will be replaced by divs. Use this option if you want to gain full control over styling via CSS. Caution: The column headers will be virtually useless when setting this option. You can use this property to achieve a floating layount instead of a table layout. Note that the widget of the first column determines the width of the tiles

property.caption: Formloader channel
property.description: If provided, all formloaders listening to this channel will follow the current selection

property.caption: Datasets
property.description: Datasets are used for search filters, dropdown actions and editable reference(sets). Datasets define how a list of items related to the current grid are retrieved and rendered.

property.caption: Dataset name
property.description: Name of this dataset, referred to by other several other settings

property.caption: Caption
property.description: Caption of the dataset, if shown in a dropdown button

property.caption: Entity
property.description: If set, all other label properties are required as well.

property.caption: Context association
property.description: How does this dataset relate to the current context?

property.caption: Item association (reference)
property.description: How does this dataset relate to the current item?

property.caption: Item association (referenceSet)
property.description: How does this dataset relate to the current item?

property.caption: Label name attribute
property.description: Caption attribute of the related object

property.caption: Constraint
property.description: Place a constraint on the items that should show up in this dataset

property.caption: New item caption
property.description: If set, new items can be added on the fly to the dataset

property.caption: Conditional visibility
property.description: Define conditions for conditional visibility here. These sets can be used in the rendering property.

property.caption: Name
property.description: Name of this condition as referred to by the rendering

property.caption: Attribute
property.description: Attribute to base the conditional visibility on

property.caption: Match values
property.description: Newline separated list of values, in which case this condition evaluates to 'true' (or: 'visible').

property.caption: CSS Class
property.description: This class is applied to every item to which this condition applies
